questions.question: How do you say 'Hello' in French?
Choose the correct article: ___ chat (cat).
questions.explanation: On dit 'un chat' car 'chat' est masculin.

questions.question: Which of these means 'Thank you'?
Plural form: One apple = une pomme. Two apples = ?
How do you say 'Good night'?
How do you say 'I eat' in French?
Form the negative: I do not like coffee.
questions.explanation: La forme correcte est 'Je n'aime pas le café'.

questions.question: How do you say 'They play football'?
questions.explanation: 'Ils jouent' est la forme correcte pour 'They play'.

questions.question: Translate: She sings.
Which sentence is correct?
options: Il ne aime pas le lait.
questions.explanation: La forme correcte est 'Il n'aime pas le lait.'

questions.question: How do you say 'What is your name?' in French?
questions.explanation: La bonne question est 'Comment tu t'appelles ?'.

questions.question: Translate: Where do you live?
How do you ask 'How are you?' formally?
Choose the correct question word: ___ est ton frère?
Translate: Do you like music?
questions.explanation: La bonne traduction est 'Aimes-tu la musique ?'.

questions.question: Conjugate: I finish (finir).
Which is correct: We are eating.
Translate: He is speaking.
How do you say: They are choosing (choisir)?
Conjugate: You (plural) are waiting (attendre).
Translate: I have eaten.
How do you say: She has gone.
questions.explanation: 'Elle est allée' est correct avec être.

questions.question: Translate: We have seen the film.
questions.explanation: La bonne traduction est 'Nous avons vu le film'.

questions.question: Choose the correct: They have finished.
Translate: You (singular) have taken the bus.
questions.explanation: 'Tu as pris le bus' est correct.

questions.question: Translate: I will eat.
questions.explanation: 'Je vais manger' est le futur proche.

questions.question: Translate: They will come tomorrow.
questions.explanation: 'Ils viendront demain' est le futur simple.

questions.question: How do you say: We will finish soon.
Translate: You will go to Paris.
Translate: She will speak.
Translate: This is my book.
questions.explanation: La bonne phrase est 'C'est mon livre'.

questions.question: Choose the correct pronoun: Marie et moi = ?
Translate: Their house is big.
Translate: I like this book.
questions.explanation: La bonne traduction est 'J'aime ce livre'.

questions.question: Choose the correct: She is more intelligent than him.
options: Elle est plus intelligente que lui
Elle est plus intelligent que lui
Elle est plus intelligente de lui
Elle est très intelligente que lui
questions.explanation: 'Elle est plus intelligente que lui' est correct.

questions.question: Translate: The man who is speaking is my teacher.
options: L'homme qui parle est mon professeur
L'homme quel parle est mon professeur
L'homme que parle est mon professeur
L'homme dont parle est mon professeur
questions.explanation: La bonne traduction est 'L'homme qui parle est mon professeur'.

questions.question: Translate: I know the girl that you saw.
options: Je connais la fille que tu as vue
Je connais la fille qui tu as vue
Je connais la fille dont tu as vue
Je connais la fille laquelle tu as vue
questions.explanation: La bonne traduction est 'la fille que tu as vue'.

questions.question: Translate: We are eating when she arrives.
questions.explanation: 'Nous mangeons quand elle arrive' est correct.

questions.question: Translate: The book that I read was interesting.
options: Le livre que j'ai lu était intéressant
Le livre qui j'ai lu était intéressant
Le livre dont j'ai lu était intéressant
Le livre lequel j'ai lu était intéressant
questions.explanation: 'Le livre que j'ai lu était intéressant' est correct.

questions.question: Translate: The city where I was born.
options: La ville où je suis né
La ville quand je suis né
La ville que je suis né
La ville dont je suis né
questions.explanation: On dit 'La ville où je suis né'.

questions.question: Translate: It is important that you study.
options: Il est important que tu étudies
Il est important que tu étudie
Il est important que tu étudier
questions.explanation: Le subjonctif correct est 'que tu étudies'.

questions.question: Translate: I would like to travel.
questions.explanation: La bonne phrase est 'Je voudrais voyager'.

questions.question: Translate: If I had money, I would buy a car.
options: Si j'avais de l'argent, j'achèterais une voiture
Si j'ai de l'argent, j'achète une voiture
Si j'aurais de l'argent, j'achèterai une voiture
questions.explanation: 'Si j'avais de l'argent, j'achèterais une voiture' est correct.

questions.question: Translate: I doubt that he will come.
Translate: We would go if it were sunny.
questions.explanation: La bonne phrase est 'Nous irions s'il faisait beau'.

questions.question: Translate the idiom: 'It's raining cats and dogs.'
options: Il pleut des chiens et chats
questions.explanation: 'Il pleut des cordes' est l'expression correcte.

questions.question: Translate: Break a leg!
Translate: The early bird catches the worm.
options: L'avenir appartient à ceux qui se lèvent tôt
questions.explanation: L'équivalent français est 'L'avenir appartient à ceux qui se lèvent tôt'.

questions.question: Reading: 'Il était une fois un roi qui vivait dans un château.' What does this mean?
options: Once upon a time, a king lived in a castle
A king is living in a castle
The king will live in a castle
questions.explanation: La traduction est 'Once upon a time, a king lived in a castle'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the subjunctive correctly?
options: Il faut que tu sois à l'heure
Il faut que tu es à l'heure
Il faut tu sois à l'heure
Il faut tu être à l'heure
questions.explanation: La phrase correcte est 'Il faut que tu sois à l'heure'.

questions.question: How do you say 'Bonjour' in English?
Choose the correct article: ___ dog.
Which of these means 'Merci'?
Plural form: One book = one book. Two books = ?
How do you say 'Bonne nuit' in English?
How do you say 'Je mange' in English?
Form the negative: I do not like tea.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'I don't like tea'.

questions.question: How do you say 'Ils jouent au football'?
Translate: 'Elle chante'.
Which sentence is correct?
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'He doesn't like milk.'

questions.question: How do you say 'Comment tu t'appelles ?' in English?
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'What is your name?'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Où habites-tu ?'
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'Where do you live?'.

questions.question: How do you ask 'Comment allez-vous ?' formally?
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'How are you?'.

questions.question: Choose the correct question word: ___ is your brother?
Translate: 'Aimes-tu la musique ?'
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'Do you like music?'.

questions.question: Conjugate: I finish.
Which is correct: We are eating.
Translate: 'Il parle' in English.
How do you say: 'Ils choisissent'?
Conjugate: You (plural) are waiting.
Translate: 'J'ai mangé'.
questions.explanation: 'I have eaten' is the correct translation.

questions.question: How do you say: 'Elle est allée'?
Translate: 'Nous avons vu le film'.
questions.explanation: 'We have seen the movie' is correct.

questions.question: Choose the correct: 'Ils ont fini'.
Translate: 'Tu as pris le bus'.
questions.explanation: 'You have taken the bus' is correct.

questions.question: Translate: 'Je vais manger'.
Translate: 'Ils viendront demain'.
How do you say: 'Nous finirons bientôt'.
Translate: 'Tu iras à Paris'.
questions.explanation: 'You will go to Paris' is correct.

questions.question: Translate: 'Elle parlera'.
Translate: 'C'est mon livre'.
Choose the correct pronoun: Marie and I = ?
Translate: 'Leur maison est grande'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'Their house is big'.

questions.question: Translate: 'J'aime ce livre'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'I like this book'.

questions.question: Choose the correct: 'Elle est plus intelligente que lui'.
options: She is more intelligent than him
She is most intelligent than him
She is much intelligent than him
questions.explanation: The correct is 'She is more intelligent than him'.

questions.question: Translate: 'L'homme qui parle est mon professeur'.
options: The man who is speaking is my teacher
The man that speaking is my teacher
The man which speaks is my teacher
The man talks is my teacher
questions.explanation: 'The man who is speaking is my teacher' is correct.

questions.question: Translate: 'Je connais la fille que tu as vue'.
options: I know the girl that you saw
I know the girl who you saw
I know girl that you saw
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'I know the girl that you saw'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Nous mangeons quand elle arrive'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'We eat when she arrives'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Le livre que j'ai lu était intéressant'.
options: The book that I read was interesting
The book which I read is interesting
The book that I read interesting
The book I read were interesting
questions.explanation: The correct is 'The book that I read was interesting'.

questions.question: Translate: 'La ville où je suis né'.
options: The city where I was born
questions.explanation: The correct is 'The city where I was born'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Il est important que tu étudies'.
options: It is important that you study
It is important that you studied
questions.explanation: The correct is 'It is important that you study'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Je voudrais voyager'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'I would like to travel'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Si j'avais de l'argent, j'achèterais une voiture'.
options: If I had money, I would buy a car
If I have money, I buy a car
If I would have money, I buy a car
If I had money, I buy car
questions.explanation: The correct is 'If I had money, I would buy a car'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Je doute qu'il vienne'.
options: I doubt that he will come
questions.explanation: The correct is 'I doubt that he will come'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Nous irions s'il faisait beau'.
options: We would go if it were sunny
We go if it is sunny
We will go if it will be sunny
We gone if it was sunny
questions.explanation: The correct is 'We would go if it were sunny'.

questions.question: Translate the idiom: 'Il pleut des cordes'.
questions.explanation: 'It's raining cats and dogs' is the idiomatic translation.

questions.question: Translate: 'Bonne chance!'
Translate: 'L'avenir appartient à ceux qui se lèvent tôt'.
options: The early bird catches the worm
The future belongs to those who wake up early
questions.explanation: 'The early bird catches the worm' is the idiomatic translation.

questions.question: Reading: 'Once upon a time, there was a king who lived in a castle.' Translate to French meaning.
options: Il était une fois un roi qui vivait dans un château
Un roi vit dans un château
Le roi vivait dans un château
Il y avait un roi dans le château
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'Il était une fois un roi qui vivait dans un château'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the subjunctive correctly?
options: It is necessary that he be on time
It is necessary he is on time
It is necessary that he is on time
It is necessary he be on time
questions.explanation: The correct is 'It is necessary that he be on time'.

questions.question: How do you say 'Hello' in Spanish?
Choose the correct article: ___ perro.
questions.explanation: We use 'el' with masculine nouns like 'perro'.

questions.question: Which of these means 'Thank you'?
Plural form: Un libro = one book. Dos libros = ?
How do you say 'Good night' in Spanish?
How do you say 'I eat' in Spanish?
Form the negative: No me gusta el té.
questions.explanation: 'No me gusta el té' means 'I don't like tea'.

questions.question: How do you say 'They play soccer'?
Translate: 'She sings'.
Which sentence is correct?
options: A él no le gusta la leche.
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'A él no le gusta la leche.'

questions.question: How do you say 'What is your name?' in Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct translation is '¿Cómo te llamas?'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Where do you live?'
How do you ask 'How are you?' formally?
questions.explanation: The correct formal translation is '¿Cómo está usted?'.

questions.question: Choose the correct question word: ¿___ es tu hermano?
Translate: 'Do you like music?'
questions.explanation: The correct translation is '¿Te gusta la música?'.

questions.question: Conjugate: Yo termino.
Which is correct: 'We are eating.'
Translate: 'He speaks' in Spanish.
How do you say: 'They choose'?
Conjugate: 'You (plural) are waiting.'
Translate: 'Yo comí'.
How do you say: 'She went'?
Translate: 'Nosotros vimos la película'.
Choose the correct: 'Ellos terminaron'.
Translate: 'Tú tomaste el autobús'.
Translate: 'Yo comeré'.
Translate: 'Ellos vendrán mañana'.
How do you say: 'Nosotros terminaremos pronto'.
Translate: 'Tú irás a París'.
questions.explanation: 'You will go to Paris' is correct.

questions.question: Translate: 'Ella hablará'.
Translate: 'Este es mi libro'.
Choose the correct pronoun: María y yo = ?
Translate: 'Su casa es grande'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'Their house is big' (su can mean his/her/their).

questions.question: Translate: 'Me gusta este libro'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'I like this book'.

questions.question: Choose the correct: 'Ella es más inteligente que él'.
options: She is more intelligent than him
She is most intelligent than him
She is much intelligent than him
questions.explanation: The correct is 'She is more intelligent than him'.

questions.question: Translate: 'El hombre que habla es mi profesor'.
options: The man who is speaking is my teacher
The man that speaking is my teacher
The man which speaks is my teacher
The man talks is my teacher
questions.explanation: 'The man who is speaking is my teacher' is correct.

questions.question: Translate: 'Conozco a la chica que viste'.
options: I know the girl that you saw
I know the girl who you saw
I know girl that you saw
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'I know the girl that you saw'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Comemos cuando ella llega'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'We eat when she arrives'.

questions.question: Translate: 'El libro que leí era interesante'.
options: The book that I read was interesting
The book which I read is interesting
The book that I read interesting
The book I read were interesting
questions.explanation: The correct is 'The book that I read was interesting'.

questions.question: Translate: 'La ciudad donde nací'.
options: The city where I was born
questions.explanation: The correct is 'The city where I was born'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Es importante que estudies'.
options: It is important that you study
It is important that you studied
questions.explanation: The correct is 'It is important that you study'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Me gustaría viajar'.
questions.explanation: The correct is 'I would like to travel'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Si tuviera dinero, compraría un carro'.
options: If I had money, I would buy a car
If I have money, I buy a car
If I would have money, I buy a car
If I had money, I buy car
questions.explanation: The correct is 'If I had money, I would buy a car'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Dudo que él venga'.
options: I doubt that he will come
questions.explanation: The correct is 'I doubt that he will come'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Iríamos si hiciera buen tiempo'.
options: We would go if it were nice weather
We go if it is nice weather
We will go if it will be nice weather
We gone if it was nice weather
questions.explanation: The correct is 'We would go if it were nice weather'.

questions.question: Translate the idiom: 'Llueve a cántaros'.
questions.explanation: 'It's raining cats and dogs' is the idiomatic translation.

questions.question: Translate: '¡Buena suerte!'
Translate: 'Al que madruga, Dios le ayuda'.
options: The early bird catches the worm
God helps those who wake up early
questions.explanation: 'The early bird catches the worm' is the idiomatic translation.

questions.question: Reading: 'Érase una vez un rey que vivía en un castillo.' What does this mean?
options: Once upon a time there was a king who lived in a castle
A king lives in a castle
The king lived in a castle
There was a king in the castle
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'Once upon a time there was a king who lived in a castle'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the subjunctive correctly?
options: Es necesario que él llegue a tiempo
Es necesario él llega a tiempo
Es necesario que él llega a tiempo
Es necesario él llegue a tiempo
questions.explanation: The correct is 'Es necesario que él llegue a tiempo'.

questions.question: How do you say 'Hello' in German?
Choose the correct article: ___ Hund.
questions.explanation: We use 'der' with masculine nouns like 'Hund'.

questions.question: Which of these means 'Thank you'?
Plural form: Ein Buch = one book. Zwei Bücher = ?
How do you say 'Good night' in German?
How do you say 'I eat' in German?
Form the negative: Ich mag keinen Tee.
questions.explanation: 'Ich mag keinen Tee' means 'I don't like tea'.

questions.question: How do you say 'They play soccer'?
Translate: 'She sings'.
Which sentence is correct?
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is 'Er mag keine Milch.'

questions.question: How do you say 'What is your name?' in German?
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'Wie heißt du?'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Where do you live?'
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'Wo wohnst du?'.

questions.question: How do you ask 'How are you?' formally?
questions.explanation: The correct formal translation is 'Wie geht es Ihnen?'.

questions.question: Choose the correct question word: ___ ist dein Bruder?
Translate: 'Do you like music?'
questions.explanation: The correct translation is 'Magst du Musik?'.

title: German Grammar Level 4
description: Present tense conjugation and modal verbs.

questions.question: Conjugate: Ich kann schwimmen.
Which is correct: 'We are working.'
Translate: 'He must go' in German.
How do you say: 'They want to learn'?
Conjugate: 'You (formal) should come.'
questions.explanation: 'Sie sollten kommen' is correct for formal 'you'.

questions.question: Choose the correct article: Ich sehe ___ Hund (accusative).
Translate: 'The woman reads a book.'
questions.explanation: 'Die Frau liest ein Buch' is correct.

questions.question: Choose the correct: Ich kaufe ___ Auto (neuter, accusative).
Translate: 'We have the keys.'
questions.explanation: 'Wir haben die Schlüssel' is correct (plural accusative).

questions.question: Choose the correct: Der Mann gibt ___ Kind ein Geschenk (dative).
Translate: 'Ich bin gegangen'.
How do you say: 'She came back'?
Translate: 'Wir haben das Buch gelesen'.
questions.explanation: 'We have read the book' is correct.

questions.question: Choose the correct: 'Er ruft mich an.' (present)
questions.explanation: 'He calls me' is correct for separable verb 'anrufen'.

questions.question: Translate: 'They turned off the TV.'
questions.explanation: 'Sie haben den Fernseher ausgemacht' is correct.

questions.question: Translate: 'Ich helfe meinem Freund'.
questions.explanation: 'I help my friend' is correct (dative case).

questions.question: Choose the correct: Das Buch liegt auf ___ Tisch.
Translate: 'Wir gehen mit unseren Eltern'.
questions.explanation: 'We go with our parents' is correct (mit + dative).

questions.question: Choose the correct: Er kommt aus ___ Schweiz.
Translate: 'The gift is for my sister.'
options: Das Geschenk ist für meine Schwester
Das Geschenk ist für meiner Schwester
Das Geschenk ist zu meine Schwester
Das Geschenk ist an meine Schwester

questions.question: Translate: 'Der Mann, der spricht, ist mein Lehrer'.
options: The man who is speaking is my teacher
The man that speaking is my teacher
The man which speaks is my teacher
The man talks is my teacher
questions.explanation: 'The man who is speaking is my teacher' is correct.

questions.question: Choose the correct genitive: Das Auto ___ Mannes ist rot.
Translate: 'Das ist das Haus meiner Großmutter'.
options: That is the house with my grandmother

questions.question: Translate: 'Die Frau, deren Buch ich lese'.
options: The woman whose book I read
The woman which book I read
The woman that book I read
The woman her book I read

questions.question: Choose the correct: Während ___ Winters bleibe ich zu Hause.
Translate: 'Ich wünschte, ich hätte mehr Zeit'.
options: I wish I had more time
I wished I have more time
I wish I have more time
I am wishing I had time

questions.question: Translate: 'Wenn ich reich wäre, würde ich reisen'.
options: If I were rich, I would travel
If I am rich, I travel
If I was rich, I travel
When I am rich, I will travel

questions.question: Choose the polite form: ___ Sie mir bitte helfen?
Translate: 'Er sagte, er sei müde' (indirect speech).
Choose the correct: 'Als ob er alles ___ ' (as if he knew everything).
Translate the idiom: 'Es regnet Bindfäden'.
questions.explanation: 'It's raining cats and dogs' is the idiomatic translation.

questions.question: Translate the passive: 'Das Haus wird gebaut'.
Translate: 'Morgenstund hat Gold im Mund'.
options: The early bird catches the worm
Morning hour has gold in mouth
questions.explanation: 'The early bird catches the worm' is the idiomatic translation.

questions.question: Choose the correct word order: Ich glaube, dass er morgen ___ (comes).
questions.explanation: In subordinate clauses, verb goes to the end: 'dass er morgen kommt'.

questions.question: Translate: 'Das Buch ist bereits gelesen worden' (passive perfect).
options: The book has already been read
The book will already be read

title: English Grammar Quiz for Beginners
description: Test your knowledge of basic English grammar.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
options: Me and him went to the store.
Him and me went to the store.
He and I went to the store.
I and he went to the store.
questions.explanation: Use subject pronouns (he, she, I, we, they) with verbs.

questions.question: Choose the correct past tense of 'eat'.
questions.explanation: 'Ate' is the simple past tense of 'eat'.

questions.question: What is the plural of 'child'?
Which sentence uses the correct article?
questions.explanation: Use 'an' before words beginning with a vowel sound.
